title: Jim Leis
text:
Jim Leis (born January 1959) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1980s.
Playing career.
A New South Wales representative forward, he played in the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League">New South Wales Rugby League</a> (NSWRL) competition for <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs</a> for three seasons between 1980 and 1982, <a href="Bulldogs%20%28NRL%20team%29">Canterbury-Bankstown</a> for three seasons between 1983–1985 and the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a> for two seasons between 1986 and 1987.
In his debut first-grade season, Leis was selected to represent <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20state%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> in the 2nd state of residence game, and kept his place at for the inaugural <a href="1980%20Rugby%20League%20State%20of%20Origin%20game">State of Origin</a> game in 1980. In the same year he was selected to tour New Zealand with the <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian national team</a> although he did not play in a test, and earned two <a href="Dally%20M">Dally M</a> awards in 1980 for lock-forward of the year and rookie of the year. He retired after the 1987 season after eight seasons in first grade.
Leis was named at lock in the <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs Magpies</a> Team of the Eighties.
Starting his career in the country, Leis is a supporter promoting rugby league in country regions.
